stanza.line: Love is my sin and thy dear virtue hatehate
Hate of my sin grounded on sinful lovingloving
O but with mine compare thou thine own statestate
And thou shalt find it merits not reprovingreproving
Or if it do not from those lips of thinethine
That have profaned their scarlet ornamentsornaments
And sealed false bonds of love as oft as minemine
Robbed others beds revenues of their rentsrents
Be it lawful I love thee as thou lov thosethose
Whom thine eyes woo as mine importune theethee
Root pity in thy heart that when it growsgrows
Thy pity may deserve to pitied bebe
If thou dost seek to have what thou dost hidehide
By self-example mayst thou be denieddenied
